description: Exp 1 semantic element definitions — dual-track (confirmatory + exploratory)

tracks.A: Prereg-faithful: uses Exp 0 expected_elements exactly as defined in tasks.json
tracks.B: Expanded atomic: each countable fact is one element (exploratory)

tasks.instruction: Agent A asks Agent B for the status of a web server.

elements.name: query_intent
elements.check: A query or question is expressed

elements.name: target_server
elements.check: A web server is referenced as the query target

elements.name: query_intent
elements.check: A query or question is expressed

elements.name: target_server
elements.check: A web server is referenced as the query target

track_b.note: Tracks A and B are identical for this task

tasks.instruction: Agent B tells Agent A that the server is healthy with 99.7% uptime.

elements.name: inform_intent
elements.check: An inform or tell action is expressed

elements.name: uptime_value
elements.check: A numeric uptime value close to 99.7% is present

elements.name: inform_intent
elements.check: An inform or tell action is expressed

elements.name: uptime_value
elements.check: A numeric uptime value close to 99.7% is present

track_b.note: Tracks A and B are identical for this task

tasks.instruction: A service agent reports a 404 not-found error to the caller agent.

elements.name: sender
elements.check: A sending agent (service agent) is identified

elements.name: error_intent
elements.check: An error report action is expressed

elements.name: sender
elements.check: A sending agent (service agent) is identified

elements.name: error_intent
elements.check: An error report action is expressed

track_b.note: Tracks A and B are identical for this task

tasks.instruction: A CI agent requests a builder agent to build a specific repo branch and commit.

elements.name: sender
elements.check: A sending agent (CI agent) is identified

elements.name: request_intent
elements.check: A request or command action is expressed

elements.name: repo
elements.check: A repository identifier is present (any name/string)

elements.name: branch
elements.check: A branch identifier is present (any name/string)

elements.name: commit
elements.check: A commit reference is present (any hash/string)

elements.name: sender
elements.check: A sending agent (CI agent) is identified

elements.name: request_intent
elements.check: A request or command action is expressed

elements.name: repo
elements.check: A repository identifier is present (any name/string)

elements.name: branch
elements.check: A branch identifier is present (any name/string)

elements.name: commit
elements.check: A commit reference is present (any hash/string)

track_b.note: Tracks A and B are identical for this task

tasks.instruction: A supplier proposes selling 10000 widgets at $2.50 each. The buyer counters with $2.20, citing market average of $2.15.

elements.name: item
elements.check: Widgets are mentioned as the product

elements.name: price
elements.check: A price of $2.50 per unit is present

elements.name: justification
elements.check: Some justification for the counter is present (market average, reasoning, etc.)

elements.name: supplier_sender
elements.check: A supplier agent is identified as sender of the proposal

elements.name: buyer_receiver
elements.check: A buyer agent is identified as receiver of the proposal

elements.name: item_widgets
elements.check: Widgets are mentioned as the product

elements.name: price_2_50
elements.check: A price of $2.50 per unit is present

elements.name: buyer_counter_sender
elements.check: The buyer is identified as sender of the counter

elements.name: counter_price_2_20
elements.check: A counter price of $2.20 is present

elements.name: market_average_2_15
elements.check: A market average of $2.15 is cited

elements.name: justification_present
elements.check: Reasoning connecting market average to counter price is present

track_b.note: Track B expands: separates counter sender identity, splits counter price from justification data, distinguishes market average as separate fact

tasks.instruction: A planner distributes a data processing task across 3 workers, splitting range 0-3000 into three equal segments.

elements.name: request_intent
elements.check: A task distribution/request action is expressed

elements.name: task_type
elements.check: Data processing is mentioned as the task type

elements.name: data_ranges
elements.check: Data ranges covering 0-3000 in three segments are specified

elements.name: request_intent
elements.check: A task distribution/request action is expressed

elements.name: task_type
elements.check: Data processing is mentioned as the task type

track_b.note: Track B expands: 3 individual workers instead of 'receivers_multiple', 3 individual ranges instead of 'data_ranges'. Ranges need not be exact boundaries — any valid 3-way split of 0-3000 is accepted.

tasks.instruction: An orchestrator instructs a pipeline to fetch a URL, parse it as JSON, then store the result in a database. Include message ID and protocol version.

elements.name: sequence_of_actions
elements.check: A sequence of fetch→parse→store actions is expressed in order

elements.name: action_fetch
elements.check: A fetch/retrieve URL action is present

track_b.note: Track B expands: 3 individual pipeline steps instead of 'sequence_of_actions'

tasks.instruction: A monitor publishes a severity-2 incident alert about payments service with latency > 2s. Include priority level 4, the causal chain (high latency caused by database connection pool exhaustion caused by traffic spike), and a resolution recommendation.

elements.name: receiver
elements.check: A receiving agent is identified (any agent or broadcast)

elements.name: causal_chain
elements.check: A causal chain linking high latency, pool exhaustion, and traffic spike is expressed

elements.name: receiver
elements.check: A receiving agent is identified (any agent or broadcast)

elements.name: service_payments
elements.check: Payments service is identified as affected

elements.name: cause_pool_exhaustion
elements.check: Database connection pool exhaustion is identified as proximate cause

elements.name: cause_traffic_spike
elements.check: Traffic spike is identified as root cause

track_b.note: Track B expands: separates service name, latency threshold, and individual causal links from the compound elements

tasks.instruction: Write a 3-message conversation: (1) Agent A queries Agent B for diagnostics, (2) Agent B replies with bottleneck info and connection stats, (3) Agent A requests scaling. All messages must have IDs, protocol version, timestamps, and reply-to links.

elements.name: reply_threading
elements.check: Messages are linked via reply-to references

elements.name: metadata_complete
elements.check: Messages include IDs, version, and timestamps

elements.name: diagnostics_data
elements.check: Bottleneck info and connection stats are present in message 2

elements.name: scaling_request
elements.check: A scaling request is present in message 3

elements.name: msg3_reply_link
elements.check: Message 3 references a prior message ID

track_b.note: Track B fully decomposes the conversation. Track A treats metadata_complete and reply_threading as compound checks. The 22-element count is dominated by metadata (9) and identity (6). Report both full (22) and content-only (~7 elements: b14, b17, b18, b19, b22 + threading b10, b11) as sub-analysis.
